subject: Women
College Athletics
Hockey, Ice
lead_paragraph: Kim Martin stopped 28 shots Saturday to lead host Minnesota Duluth to a 4-0 victory over Wisconsin and its first N.C.A.A. women’s hockey championship since 2003.Minnesota Duluth captured its fourth national title in eight years. The victory avenged a 4-1 loss to Wisconsin in the women’s Frozen Four final last year. Wisconsin had won the previous two titles.Haley Irwin, Emmanuelle Blais, Sara O’Toole and Karine Demeule scored for the Bulldogs (34-4-1), who beat Wisconsin (29-9-3) in five of six meetings this season.
